page.title: 15STONERAISE PRIMARY SCHOOL(1)
page.content: The log book of the school shows that it was founded in about 1874.It was extended in 1960.The name Stoneraise comes from the fact that when the school was built a huge terminal moraine from an Ice_Age glacier had to be cleared.Near the school thousands of tons of these stones were used in the construction of the nearby M6.The area was once part of the vast Inglewood Forest,only vestiges of which still remain.At one time,early in the school's life,nearly all the children who came to the school were farm workers children.Farms employed many labourer's who lived in tied cottages.These labourers had large families and the school was always full.Also,after the last war many families from the outskirts of Carlisle were re_housed in nearby Low Moor estate.These children also came.
